item.description:
A free lecture about Fracking is being put on at the New Haven Public Library and I intend on going to it.  I honestly don't know a lot about Fracking, other than green folk are making it out as a huge environmental problem, so it will be good to learn.

I'm going to try and get a decent seat at 6:15, lecture starts at 6:30.

More info on the event can be found at THIS link.

There's first come first serve FREE Parking near by in Yale's Lot 51 on Temple Street (Lot is between houses 302 and 320).  Otherwise if parking you'd probably need to find a metered spot on Temple or Elm.  ($1.50/hr until 9pm)

The Event description also promises Snacks, but no details on them.

I'm going in hopes I will find out if this is like Nuclear Energy and everyone's making a big Frackin' deal out of some thing that can be properly handled, or if there's more serious problems many of us are overlooking.  Right now I suppose I have very little Frackin' clue.  ;-)

P.S. - If any of you wear a BSG related costume I will be very entertained... no that's not required and I don't have one, I'm just saying.  :-P
item.how_to_find_us: Event is in the Community Public Room. It's my first time in that room, so I'll be lost to :-P, you can text 315-345-9348 if you don't see me, but phone will be off once lecture begins.
item.name: Science Lecture: "Fracking: Energy Angel or Environmental Demon?"
